channel.title: Posts on Data Science (SpSe22)
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Data Science (SpSe22)

item.title: Fundamental object types in R I: Functions
item.description: Overview We already learned that everything in R that exists is an object. You most likely already noted that there are different types of objects: 2, for instance, was a number, but assign was a function.^[In fact, we will learn below that 2 is not really a number, but a vector or length 1. Only in a next step, 2 counts as a ‘number’, or, more precisely as a ‘double’.] As you might have guessed, there are many more types of objects.

item.title: Fundamental object types in R II: Vectors

You most likely already noted that there are different types of objects: 2, for instance, was a number, but assign was a function.^[In fact, we will learn below that 2 is not really a number, but a vector or length 1. Only in a next step, 2 counts as a ‘number’, or, more precisely as a ‘double’.] As you might have guessed, there are many more types of objects.
